resources.string: Andsens SQLite manager. Manage your Android databases
Number of lines to retrieve when paging data
SQLite does not store auto index definitions
Must at least give a file name
You clicked on this SQLite database:
No. of recently opened databases to save
sqlite_master is a read only system table
If your phone is rootet you can edit system databases with aSQLiteManager using aShell

You have now used aSQLiteManager in more than a week and at least 10 times. 
If you like using it, please support it by a good rating. 
You can also donate a small amount of money (from the home page). It will be used to improve the program. 
Thanks for your support!
If you can reproduce this error please tell me by mail how to provoke it ;-) \nYou can also also use aLogViewer to extract extra informations form the system log to help me find out what is wrong.
Entering a root catalog be careful:
Do you want to open a copy of
The su executable can be located in different places inside or outside of your path
Time to wait after starting to copy database before opening it
Root shell binary not found in standard location (or phone not rooted). You can define root shell location in configuration.
Use aShell root file picker to access system databases on rooted phones
Enable logging to retrieve debugging informations

Editing system databases is experimental and potential dangerous - you might destroy data. 

Do not alter system databases unless you know what you are doing! 

Take care!
You must enter a field name!
You must enter a table name and at least one field!
Index definition copied to clip board
DESC and AutoInc must not both be checked although the manual says otherwise
Font size to use data list
Always keep main screen in portrait (after restart)
Use lists when editing FK fields
Do you really want to reset all preferences?
All preferences were reseted to default
No valid database has been opened
Both foreign key table and field must be specified""

From this main screen you can: 

Open an existing database located on the sdCard 
Create a new database on the sdCard 
Open one of your recently used database 
Show brief informations about aSQLiteManager 

You can also configure aSQLiteManager, show a list of implemented functions and reset the configuration by hitting the Menu button. 

As aSQLIteManager is a SQLite front end it is only possible to do with the databases what SQLite allows. This rules out nearly all changes to table structure.

From query screen you can: 

Execute any valid SQLite SQL statements. 

Using the Menu button you have access to a simple SQL builder, This can help with building select, create, drop, delete and insert commands. 

 Query results can be exported to text files (located in the same catalog as the database). 

You can start transactions, roll back and commit changes to data. 

To copy the content of a data cell to the clip board just tap at the cell.

From database screen you can: 

See all tables, views and indexes. 

Delete tables, views and indexes by "long tapping" the item you want to delete. It is not possible to delete SQLietes auto generated indexes. 

From the Menu button you have access to: 
Export and restore of databases 
Open files containing SQL commands (can be executed line by line whole script) 
Info about current database and 
A New Table wizard that can guide through the creation of a new table

From table viewer you can: 

See the structure of the selected table 
See its data and page through the data (set the page size in configuration on main screen) 
Add new records (by using the "New" button or by tapping New cell in the title row) 
Edit a row by tapping Edit in the first cell of the row 
To delete a record tap Edit and and use the Delete button 

From the Menu you can: 

Jump to the first / last page 
Add a simple filter to data 
Dump the table to a SQL script (located in the same catalog as the database) 
See the SQL needed to create the table. This can be copied to the clip board by tapping the cell
Translate aSQLiteManager to your language and get your name here

Visit aSQLiteMagers's home page at: 
http://aaa.andsen.dk/aSQLiteManager.html 
To get a complete list of the functionality supported by aSQLiteManager. 

You can also send comments bug reports and feature requests to me at: 
android41cv@gmail.com 

 
A create databases tool to easily create tables 
Easy deletion of tables, views and indexes 
Foreign key constraint checking can be turned on 
Editing foreign key fields using selection list 
Open databases from aSQLiteManager or from file managers 
List tables, views and indexes 
Database info 
Display data from tables and views 
Fields in the table viewer are colored based on the type of the field. As SQLite doesn't has field type validation the field type can differ from field type given with the create table statement 
Data editing and deleting form table browser from Edit label at each row 
Data entry add record from label on title at data browser 
Execute any SQL including 'Drop' / 'Create' statements 
Support for BLOB fields (except during editing) 
Support Begin transaction, Commit and Rollback 
Copy any cell to the clip board by pressing it 
Support table names and field names with spaces 
Store all executed statements in the opened database in a table called aSQLiteManager (by default turned off) 
Select SQL history from query form 
Export database to SQL script and restore databases from script 
Dump table from table view to file named Database.Table.sql - can be loaded by execute file as script 
Export of query results to ASCII file 
Execute SQL scripts, full script or single lines 
Remember recently opened databases for quick access to often used databases 
Use aShell (Beta) to edit system databases on rooted devices 

Martin

aSQLiteManager is a free open source SQLite manager / front end for Android devices. 

New in this version (3.2): 

• Select where to create a new database using a directory picker – thanks to Malte Heizelmann 
• You get tips about what is possible in the different parts of the program 
• Foreign key selection lists now show a string representation of the records not just the FK fields. The field that the foreign key refers to MUST be the primary key in the referenced table 
• More checking in create table wizard 
• Hopefully back on the French version of Google Play (I had placed an unfinished French translation in a wrong place) 
• French translation – thanks to Jean-Luc Rostini + Nicolas Gourdon 
• Italian translation – thanks to Giuseppe Tumino https://play.google.com/store/apps/developer?id=Giuseppe+Tumino 
• Catalan translation – thanks to Paco Rivière 
• Brazilian translation – thanks to Leandro Lopes 
• Spanish translation – thanks to Gonzalo Rodriguez 
• Several bug fixes – thanks for reporting! 

For a description of all features check: 
aaa.andsen.dk/aSQLiteManager.html 

Comments, bug reports and feature requests are welcome. just drop me a mail at: 
android41cv@gmail.com 

And thanks to those of you who report bugs instead of complaining ;-) 

Hope you enjoy the app! 

Martin
